question.title: Jibx-maven-plugin JDK 17 support
question.body:
I am trying to upgrade Java from version 8 to 17. I am getting some error related to jibx-maven-plugin. I am using the jibx-maven-plugin to generate xml bindings from the .xsd files. Earlier I was using maven-jibx-plugin but I guess now it has been renamed to jibx-maven-plugin. With the latest version as 1.4.2 for jibx-maven-plugin. Depending on the versions of bcel dependency version the error chnages. For version version less than equal to 6.5.0 i get some error related to wrong name and some of the files related to like JiBX_bindings_addmultielements_queryMungeAdapter are not getting genertaed. For Bcel version above 6.5.0:

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.jibx:maven-jibx-plugin:1.3.1:bind(compile-binding) on project ac-oneaxml:
                                                                                                                                       [ERROR] *** Error during code generation for file

[ERROR]  this may be due to an error in your binding or classpath, or to an error in the JiBX code

[ERROR] : LocalVariableTable name index programming error: max 65,536 > 65,535

What could be the solution for this?

For versions higher than 6.5.0 i am getting the following error: Error during code generation for file 'file-path' - this may be due to an error in your binding or classpath, or to an error in the JiBX code LocalVariableTable name index programming error: max 65,536 > 65,535 I tried splitting my main jibx.xml file where schema set are defined into multiple files and tried to make them small. But still got same error. Is there anything else I could try?
